RESPONDER PLACED THE PACKAGE AND ALL DEBRIS IN A TRAY AND TRANSPORTED IT BACK TO THE PROCESSING STATION WHERE THE PRODUCT AND DEBRIS WERE DISPOSED OF FOLLOWING UPS DMP PROCEDURES X-2023060702 -UPON RESPONDING WEARING PROPER PPE, RESPONDER SAW THE PACKAGE HAD LEAKED. RESPONDER PLACED THE PACKAGE AND ALL DEBRIS IN A TRAY AND TRANSPORTED IT BACK TO THE PROCESSING STATION WHERE THE PRODUCT AND DEBRIS WERE DISPOSED OF FOLLOWING UPS DMP PROCEDURES

  • Carrier/Reporter: SOUTHWEST AIRLINES CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: The checked bag was being transported from the transfer point area to the aircraft when it fell off the bag-cart and was dragged which caused the battery to catch on fire. There were no identifying marks, the battery was similar in size to a cell phone battery. SWA FAA PHI Craig Nutt was advised of the incident.

item.title: Report X-2023060653
item.description:
Report X-2023060653

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-28
  • City: LOGAN
  • State: UT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: While unloading a trailer at our station this morning the damaged hazmat package was found loaded onto the trailer upsidedown and that it had leaked out of the package and onto two other packages damaging only one of the other packages. Package was then immediatley confined in a designated red hazmat bin and taken to the QA cage for inspection along with the two packages that were spilt onto. Damaged hazmat did not release on to the trailer, the spill was confined to the cardboard of the damaged hazmat and the two other packages. DescribePack: Internal leakage due to loose caps caused by package being loaded on to trailer upsidedown DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Spill was confined to the cardboard of the damaged hazmat and two other packages one of which got damaged by the ethanol seeping through the cardboard. Damaged hazmat was confined to a designated red hazmat bin and taken to the QA cage for immediate inspection. The other two packages were also placed in bins and were sent to the QA cage for inspection.

item.title: Report X-2023060427
item.description:
Report X-2023060427

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-19
  • City: SALT LAKE CITY
  • State: UT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: WEARING FULL PPE AND FOLLOWING DECISION TREE, RESPONDER RESPONDED TO TRAILER PLACED PACKAGE IN A LINED SPILL TRAY AND RETURNED TO PROCESSING CENTER FOR FURTHER PROCESSING. UPON INSPECTION OF CONTENTS DISCOVERED CLASS 8 DIAMOND LABEL ON INTERIOR OF BOX WITH NO CORRESPONDING INDICATION ON EXTERIOR PACKAGING. HMSC CONFIRMED UNDECLARED STATUS. FOLLOWED UNDECLARED PROTOCOL.

item.title: Report X-2023060180
item.description:
Report X-2023060180

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found upside-down in a trailer. Upon discovery, a package handler attempted to handle the package before alerting QA. After QA was alerted, Package was safely transferred to a hazmat labeled tote and liner. DescribePack: Package was found to have loose caps. Multiple holes were found in the package from the corrosive liquid. DurationRel: 4 and MitigateEffect: Package was contained in a hazmat labeled liner and tote, as well as contaminated packages.

item.title: Report E-2023060013
item.description:
Report E-2023060013

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-17
  • City: W VALLEY CITY
  • State: UT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS, INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On May 17, 2023, one (1) 5-gallon pail of paint (UN1263) was damaged due to a load shift and released approximately one-half (0.5) gallon of product to the trailer floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from GrayMar Environmental Services (GES) to remediate the site. GES personnel overpacked the damaged pail into one (1) 55-gallon drum, then deployed absorbents and neutralizing agent to the released material. The crew then utilized hand tools to collect all paint and paint impacted material in the previously stated one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal.

  • Description: WEARING FULL PPE AND FOLLOWING DECISION TREE, RESPONDER RESPONDED TO TRAILER, PLACED PACKAGE IN LINED SPILL TRAY AND RETURNED TO PROCESSING CENTER FOR FURTHER PROCESSING. UPON INSPECTION OF INNER CONTENTS DISCOVERED INTERIOR PACKAGE TO BE MARKED WITH A LIMITED QUANTITY DIAMOND LABEL. THERE WAS NO CORRESPONDING LABELS ON EXTERNAL PACKEGE. HMSC CONFIRMED PACKAGE WAS UNDECLARED.

  • State: UT

  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On May 3, 2023, one (1) one-gallon pail of paint (UN1263) was damaged during transit and released approximately .25 gallons of product to its packaging. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from EnviroCare (EC) to remediate the impacted surfaces. EC personnel contained the damaged pail in one (1) 5-gallon pail for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2023050432
item.description:
Report E-2023050432

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-02
  • City: W VALLEY CITY
  • State: UT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On May 2, 2022, an unknown amount of 5-gallon pails of paint were damaged during transit and released approximately ten (10) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from EnviroCare, Inc. (ECI) to remediate the site. ECI personnel utilized granular absorbents and hand tools to collect and containerize all paint impacted material into four (4) 55-gallon drums for disposal by R+L.

  • Description: During sort operations at the PVUA location seven fiberboard box were discovered to containing dry ice. Each package contained 5 KG of dry ice.
